author: BlackRabbit
title: good for 5 yearolds
review:
well it was good when i was 6,jackstone was a good idea for a stepping stone from duplo to actual lego ,the parts in this were large and simple and made  it easy to build i dont much care for the jumbofigs minifigs would be much better

pros 
good for yougnger builders
i still use the propler and landing thinger

cons 
not fair to give it cons scince im much older now

author: Alemas
title: "Can do, will do!" - Jack Stone's catchphrase. Oh the cheesiness! :P
review:
Edit on 1 November 2011: I am refreshing my old reviews with some better wording and new brick ratings.

This is part of the much-hated Jack Stone theme. It was aimed at 4-year-olds, which may explain the so-called "maxifigs". The problem was that they may have been popular with its target audience, but they were pretty much hated by everyone else for the ultra-juniorised pieces and maxifigs.

Now, onto the set itself. This 'copter has 14 pieces. For £5.99? RIDICOLOUS! :P At least it has a chrome exhaust and a printed tail. But that's pretty much it. :P The rest of the pieces are huge and unusable, except for the 2 x 6 brick, and tail rotor. Not even the winch is great, as it requires two pin slots. Let's not even talk about the maxifigs; they are huge one-piece monsters. :P

Pros

  • Chrome exhaust

Cons

  • Maxifigs
  • Ugly
  • 14 pieces for £5.99
  • Useless pieces

Overall, a really rubbish set.

author: sf1378
title: WHY did I buy this?!
review:
I don't know why I bought this and the fire truck set in this theme when it first came out in 2001 in the UK. They ended up gathering dust on my window sill...

I burnt the Jack Stone figure from this set. The Helicopter Pilot Girl is UGLY! This would have been a better theme connected to Technic or rescaled for classic mini figures at the time...

author: modena
title: Winch the rotor back up when it's broken.
review:
This was a nice set, for a little boy. I still enjoy this set, mostly because of it's winch.

Pros:

  • Winch!
  • The winch can hold a lot of weight!
  • Walkie-talkies included!
  • Camera included!
  • Easy to rebuild!

Cons:

  • Blades fall off easily.
  • Very easy to build.
  • Winch can't hold weight.
  • Big minifigures.

Overall:

This was a satisfactory set. However, it's best part is the winch. Th rotor blades fall off easily, which is sad. The minifigures are also so childish, and you can't rotate their hands!

Overall, get this set for the winch, if you want it.

author: tisi
title: *SIGH* Another Jack Stone set...
review:
I hate Jack Stone, it's a fact. But I own some because I got some as a child. Probably this is the worst set ever if we don't mind Galidor and Mc Donald's promos. 

Box/Instructions

I don't own the box, but I have the instructions. It is a small folded paper with one single picture. This is the manual. There is a strange comic on it: Jack Stone and an ugly policewoman travel by the helicopter, but it breaks. Artlessly, Jack has a great idea: build a snowmobile! What a shame...

Parts

14 (!) parts? What the hell? There is no one on our tiny planet who can make a good minifig-size helicopter out of 14 pieces! And all of them are those ugly, nasty, juniorized Jack Stone parts! (OK, the camera is useful.) I give one brick, because it's the lowest rating.

Minifigures

It consists of two minifigs: Jack Stone and the pilot. Small problem: Jack Stone hasn't got helmet. Big problems: nose, ugly face, unmoveable hands, too big size, hideous uniform and so on. Useless, unplayable, nasty minifigures.

The build

~2 minutes. Nothing interesting there.

The completed model

Awful design, awful looking, no details, the whole 'helicopter' is a shame. The propeller is unsightly. The windscreen is terrible. I can't have even a good word about it. Unpardonable bad break.

Summary

I just want to see the guy who permitted this monster. Maybe he was drunk. But I hope it was just the nightmare of 2003 and we don't have to see similar 'sets' in the future.


Thanks for reading and sorry for my bad English grammar :D
